==Biography==
==Biography==
===Early life & career===
===Early life & career===
â
Andrew Wilkes-Krier was born in [[Stanford, California]], and grew up in [[Ann Arbor, Michigan|Ann Arbor]], [[Michigan]]. At age 3 he found out he could shoot lasers out of his eyes, which later sponsored his show Destroy build, DESTROY.... muffins. At age 4, he began learning classical piano at [[The University of Michigan School of Music]]. He attended the private college preparatory [[Greenhills School]] for middle school before attending the alternative [[Community High School (Ann Arbor, Michigan)|Community High School]] from 1993â1997, where he studied jazz keyboard.<ref>David Enders, âAnn Arbor Rocker Having Fun Making Music His Way,â Associated Press State & Local Wire, 30 Aug. 2002.</ref> His father is Professor [[James E. Krier]], a well-known legal scholar at the [[University of Michigan Law School]] and co-author of the widely used Dukeminier & Krier Property casebook.<ref name="bio">{{Cite web|url=http://www.andrewwk.com/index.php?page=about.php|title=ABOUT ANDREW W.K.|work=andrewwk.com|accessdate=2008-01-03}}</ref>
+
Andrew Wilkes-Krier was born in [[Stanford, California]], and grew up in [[Ann Arbor, Michigan|Ann Arbor]], [[Michigan]]. At age 4, he began learning classical piano at [[The University of Michigan School of Music]]. He attended the private college preparatory [[Greenhills School]] for middle school before attending the alternative [[Community High School (Ann Arbor, Michigan)|Community High School]] from 1993â1997, where he studied jazz keyboard.<ref>David Enders, âAnn Arbor Rocker Having Fun Making Music His Way,â Associated Press State & Local Wire, 30 Aug. 2002.</ref> His father is Professor [[James E. Krier]], a well-known legal scholar at the [[University of Michigan Law School]] and co-author of the widely used Dukeminier & Krier Property casebook.<ref name="bio">{{Cite web|url=http://www.andrewwk.com/index.php?page=about.php|title=ABOUT ANDREW W.K.|work=andrewwk.com|accessdate=2008-01-03}}</ref>
In 1993, when he was 14, Andrew joined the band Slam, later to be called Reverse Polarity. His first public recording, "Mr. Surprise", came out on a compilation released by the Westside Audio Laboratories label (now known as Ypsilanti Records) out of [[Ypsilanti, Michigan]]. Over the next 5 years he was in many different bands in Michigan such as Lab Lobotomy, The Pterodactyls, Music Band, Mr. Velocity Hopkins, The Incredibly Small Men, Kathode, The Portly Boys, Kangoo, The Beast People, Stormy Rodent, a later iteration of Scheme, the Malt Lickers, Isis and Werewolves, and Sucking Coeds. In 1994 he also started a group called Ancient Art of Boar, later making it a solo project titled AAB, which ended in 1998, when Andrew moved from Ypsilanti to [[New York City]].
In 1993, when he was 14, Andrew joined the band Slam, later to be called Reverse Polarity. His first public recording, "Mr. Surprise", came out on a compilation released by the Westside Audio Laboratories label (now known as Ypsilanti Records) out of [[Ypsilanti, Michigan]]. Over the next 5 years he was in many different bands in Michigan such as Lab Lobotomy, The Pterodactyls, Music Band, Mr. Velocity Hopkins, The Incredibly Small Men, Kathode, The Portly Boys, Kangoo, The Beast People, Stormy Rodent, a later iteration of Scheme, the Malt Lickers, Isis and Werewolves, and Sucking Coeds. In 1994 he also started a group called Ancient Art of Boar, later making it a solo project titled AAB, which ended in 1998, when Andrew moved from Ypsilanti to [[New York City]].
